result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon W. Wals was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from having contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless they are in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any activity relating to social media.
Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.
The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized .22 caliber semi automatic pistol.
Paid in full - bond previously posted to be applied.

Cases 22CF81 & 22CF59 called @ 3:12 PM: Defendant Brandon W. Wals in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Brandon W. Wals. 22CF82 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Atty Blankschein advises that the parties have reached an agreement and are prepared to proceed to P/S today. 22CF59 - The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: 22CF59: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  22CF59: Ct 3 - DRI. 22CF81 - DRI. Statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 only - S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Defendant is prohibited from having contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless they are in the immediate presence of a parent or guardian, Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any activity relating to social media, Defendant to obtain an HSED or GED, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized .22 Caliber semi automatic pistol.  Ct 2 only - 6 mos WC Jail - Huber, GT, 40 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than April 25, 2022. Appeal rights given. Defendant to report to DOC by no later than close of business on 4/12/2022.
Status conference on April 11, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
